timeline.message: PLFM-6445: Normalize request data to DB columns
PLFM-6445: Refactoring, supports starting multipart copy
PLFM-6445: Refactor to include signed headers
PLFM-6445: Store the source file handle rather than de-normalize
PLFM-6445: Multipart copy, pre-signed URL step
PLFM-6445: Multipart copy, add part step
PLFM-6445: Expose multipart copy to the API

timeline.bodyText: if bucket is equal they are in the same region (one less call to S3).
timeline.author: john-hill
john-hill

timeline.bodyText: We need to validate with AWS support if the copy guarantees integrity. If not we can potentially open a stream to the source object for the range of bytes to compute the MD5 and compare it with the added one (not ideal but still better than re-uploading).
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: this might be a good fit for variable args

timeline.bodyText: remove the types if not used.
